description: From Late Middle English vinous, vinose (“consisting of, containing, or made of wine”), from Latin vīnōsus (“fond of wine; wine-flavoured”), from vīnum (“wine”) + -ōsus (adjective-forming suffix meaning ‘full of, prone to’).

adjectives.description: vinous (comparative more vinous, superlative most vinous)

definitionGroups.group: Pertaining to or having the characteristics of wine.

entries.meaning: Having the colour of red wine; vinaceous.
Affected by the drinking of wine.
